result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed.  It is the Court's expectiation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.

Verbage left off JOC starting - Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

(2) letters in support of deft

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Deft sentenced to 30 days KCJ as a condition of probation.  Huber is allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  No restitution requested.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Atty James Fields-Bowers just appointed and requests an adjournment.  FPT 2/11/16 @ 9:10am, JS 2/29/16 @ 9am.
Atty James Fields Bowers
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Bail/Bond Signed
Spoke to deft telling him to come in to sign corrected bond.   Was to come in between 4-5 to Rm 204.

*No Contact w/ Shopko 5300 52nd Street
943.50(1m)(b) Misd Retail Theft Int Take, Repeater

225 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco    Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  Janell Thwing.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty by court.   Deft demands jury trial. Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.  $1500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Phan
and witness list filed by the State
